revised_title: Observation and Analysis of Two Parhelia or Mock-Suns
tldr: The author observes two parhelia, or mock-suns, in Wittemberg, Saxony, and analyzes their appearance, brightness, and surrounding atmospheric conditions. The phenomenon is accompanied by a partial rainbow and two distinct streams of light extending from the parhelia. The author also discusses the weather conditions during the observation and the similarity of the phenomenon to another observation in England.
